page.title: 02 THE PIER,ULLAPOOL.
page.content: Ullapool harbour is run by locally, elected persons,known as the Ullapool Harbour Trust. The port of Ullapool,with many local boats,has its own individual identity. Twenty years ago,present-day growth was not forecast,even though the port had a thriving herring klondyking industry.This lapsed from the early 1970's due to over-fishing of Minch herring stocks when purse seiners and high-powered pair trawlers were introduced. In the late 1970's,finding the pier inadequate,plans were drawn up,after the extension for ferry,to enable large,deep- draft fishing vessels to berth.In 1982 another extension gave 600 ft.extra berthing space for pelagic vessels of any draft. A further 230m.extension is planned.
